Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பேணாது பெண்விழைவான் ஆக்கம் பெரியதோர் நாணாக நாணுத் தரும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The wealth of him who, regardless (of his manliness), devotes himself to his wife's feminine nature will cause great shame (to ali men) and to himself.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A man is shown neglecting all his manly duties and achievements ('பேணாது') to dote on his wife ('பெண்விழைவான்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: His wealth and prosperity ('ஆக்கம்'), instead of being a source of pride, are shown to be transformed into a great, heavy cloak of shame ('பெரியதோர் நாண்'). This cloak is embroidered not with symbols of glory, but with symbols of his doting and submission.
Layered_Composition.Background: He is shown wearing this 'cloak of shame' in public, and it causes not only himself, but all other worthy men who see it, to feel a sense of profound secondhand embarrassment and shame ('நாணுத் தரும்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The prosperity of a man who neglects his duties to be subservient to his wife becomes a source of great shame, not just for him, but for all.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: Wealth transforming into a cloak of shame is the central metaphor. The embarrassed expressions of the onlookers show that the shame is public and widespread.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Shameful, embarrassing, unmanly, a loss of dignity.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A harsh, judgmental light shines on the man, making his cloak of shame highly visible. The onlookers are in shadow, their faces conveying their disapproval.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that focuses on the shameful man and the reactions of the crowd around him.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a strong focus on expressions of shame and contempt.
